site.title: Nepal Air Quality

common.checkConnection: Please check your connection or try again later

recommendations.good: Air quality is satisfactory, and air pollution poses little or no risk.
recommendations.moderate: Air quality is acceptable. However, there may be a risk for some people.
recommendations.unhealthySG: Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects.
recommendations.unhealthy: Everyone may begin to experience health effects.
recommendations.hazardous: Health alert: everyone may experience more serious health effects.

info.title: Air Quality in Nepal
info.description: Nepal, particularly Kathmandu Valley, faces significant air quality challenges due to rapid urbanization, increasing vehicle emissions, brick kilns, and geographical factors that trap pollutants. The valley's bowl-shaped topography restricts air movement, especially during winter when temperature inversions occur.

keyIssues.title: Key Air Quality Issues in Nepal

seasonalVariation.title: Seasonal Variation
seasonalVariation.description: Winter months (Nov-Feb) typically have the worst air quality in Nepal due to temperature inversions, increased burning, and dry conditions.

urbanHotspots.title: Urban Hotspots
urbanHotspots.description: Areas like Ratnapark, Kalanki, and Koteshwor in Kathmandu often record dangerously high pollution levels during peak hours.

indoorPollution.title: Indoor Pollution
indoorPollution.description: Many rural Nepali households still use biomass fuels for cooking and heating, contributing to severe indoor air pollution.

vulnerablePopulations.title: Vulnerable Populations
vulnerablePopulations.description: Approximately 30% of Kathmandu's children suffer from respiratory issues linked to poor air quality.

pm25.name: PM2.5
pm25.description: Fine particles measuring 2.5 micrometers or less that can penetrate deep into the lungs and enter the bloodstream.
pm25.sources: Brick kilns around Bhaktapur, vehicle emissions on Ring Road, construction dust, and seasonal forest fires in surrounding hills.
pm25.healthEffects: Common cause of respiratory issues in Kathmandu Valley, particularly affecting children and elderly populations.

pm10.name: PM10
pm10.description: Larger dust particles measuring 10 micrometers or less, commonly from road dust and construction.
pm10.sources: Unpaved roads in expanding urban areas, construction sites in Kathmandu, Lalitpur, and Bhaktapur, and brick manufacturing.
pm10.healthEffects: Triggers asthma attacks and respiratory irritation, particularly common during dry winter months in Nepal.

winterInversion.name: Winter Inversion
winterInversion.description: A seasonal phenomenon in Kathmandu Valley where cold air gets trapped under warmer air, concentrating pollutants near the ground.
winterInversion.sources: Natural valley topography combined with winter weather patterns, worsened by emissions from vehicles and industries.
winterInversion.healthEffects: Creates hazardous air quality episodes during winter months, significantly increasing hospital visits for respiratory complaints.

checkAqi.title: Check Nepal Air Quality Index
checkAqi.description: Use apps like 'Nepal AQI' or follow @NepalAirQuality on social media for daily updates specific to your location.

maskRecommendations.title: Mask Recommendations
maskRecommendations.description: N95 masks are essential during winter months in Kathmandu. Local brands like 'Nepal Masks' offer affordable options.

indoorAirManagement.title: Indoor Air Management
indoorAirManagement.description: Keep windows closed during morning rush hours (8-10 AM) when pollution typically peaks in urban centers.

airPurifiers.title: Nepal-made Air Purifiers
airPurifiers.description: Local innovations like 'Khulamanch' and 'Nepal Purifiers' offer affordable air cleaning solutions designed for local conditions.

travelTiming.title: Travel Timing
travelTiming.description: Plan commutes to avoid peak pollution hours. Air quality is typically best between 2-4 PM in Kathmandu.

purifyingPlants.title: Purifying Plants
purifyingPlants.description: Local plants like Sansevieria (Snake Plant) and Money Plant are effective at filtering indoor air pollutants.

statistics.title: Nepal Air Pollution: By The Numbers

rank.title: Global Ranking
rank.description: Nepal ranks 7th among countries with the worst air quality in the world (2023 World Air Quality Report).

deaths.title: Annual Deaths
deaths.description: Annual premature deaths in Nepal attributed to air pollution (Nepal Health Research Council, 2023).

pm25.title: Winter PM2.5
pm25.description: Average PM2.5 concentration during winter mornings in Kathmandu (5x WHO guideline limits).

statistics.sources: Sources: Nepal Health Research Council, WHO Nepal, Ministry of Health and Population, 2023-2024

good.description: Air quality is satisfactory, and air pollution poses little or no risk.
good.healthImplications: Perfect for outdoor activities around Kathmandu Valley.

moderate.description: Air quality is acceptable. However, some pollutants may be concerning for sensitive individuals.
moderate.healthImplications: People with respiratory issues should limit extended outdoor activities in Kathmandu's busy areas.

unhealthySG.description: Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects, especially near busy traffic areas like Chabahil and Kalanki.
unhealthySG.healthImplications: Elderly, children, and those with respiratory issues should limit time spent in polluted areas.

unhealthy.description: Everyone may begin to experience adverse health effects. Common during winter months in Kathmandu.
unhealthy.healthImplications: Everyone should reduce outdoor activities, particularly in urban centers and during morning rush hours.

veryUnhealthy.description: Health warnings of emergency conditions. Often experienced during pre-monsoon months.
veryUnhealthy.healthImplications: Everyone should avoid outdoor exertion. Consider using air purifiers in homes and offices.

hazardous.description: Health alert: everyone may experience serious health effects. Common during severe air pollution episodes in Kathmandu Valley.
hazardous.healthImplications: All outdoor activities should be avoided. Schools may close and masks are strongly recommended.

header.title: Understanding Air Quality
header.subtitle: A comprehensive guide to air quality measurements, pollutants, and their impact on health

introduction.mainText: Air quality is a critical environmental and health concern that affects millions of people worldwide. This guide explains the key concepts, measurements, and implications of air quality monitoring.

disclaimer.text: The information provided is based on scientific research and official environmental protection guidelines.

pollutants.title: Common Air Pollutants
pollutants.description: Learn about the major pollutants that affect air quality and their sources.

particulateMatter.title: Particulate Matter (PM2.5 & PM10)
particulateMatter.description: Microscopic particles that can penetrate deep into the lungs and bloodstream.
particulateMatter.sources: Vehicle emissions, construction, industrial activities, smoke

ozone.title: Ground-level Ozone (O₃)
ozone.description: A reactive gas formed when pollutants react with sunlight.
ozone.sources: Vehicle exhaust, industrial emissions, chemical solvents

carbonMonoxide.title: Carbon Monoxide (CO)
carbonMonoxide.description: An odorless, colorless gas that can be harmful when inhaled in large amounts.
carbonMonoxide.sources: Vehicle exhaust, indoor heating, industrial processes

nitrogenDioxide.title: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO₂)
nitrogenDioxide.description: A reddish-brown gas with a pungent odor that can irritate airways.
nitrogenDioxide.sources: Vehicle emissions, power plants, industrial processes

sulfurDioxide.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO₂)
sulfurDioxide.description: A colorless gas with a sharp odor that can harm the respiratory system.
sulfurDioxide.sources: Fossil fuel combustion, industrial activities, volcanic eruptions

ammonia.title: Ammonia (NH₃)
ammonia.description: A colorless gas with a strong odor that can form harmful particles.

aqiCalculation.title: How Air Quality Index (AQI) is Calculated
aqiCalculation.description: Understanding the methods used to calculate Air Quality Index values

usEpa.title: US EPA AQI Calculation
usEpa.description: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) uses a standardized formula to calculate AQI:

variables.title: Where:
variables.cLow: CLow = the concentration breakpoint that is ≤ C
variables.cHigh: CHigh = the concentration breakpoint that is ≥ C
variables.iLow: ILow = the index breakpoint corresponding to CLow
variables.iHigh: IHigh = the index breakpoint corresponding to CHigh

usEpa.note: This calculation is performed for each pollutant, and the highest value becomes the AQI

openWeather.title: OpenWeather AQI Scale
openWeather.description: OpenWeather uses a 1-5 scale to indicate air quality levels:

levels.1: 1 - Good: Air quality is satisfactory, poses little or no risk
levels.2: 2 - Fair: Air quality is acceptable, may pose moderate health concerns for sensitive groups
levels.3: 3 - Moderate: Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects
levels.4: 4 - Poor: Everyone may begin to experience health effects
levels.5: 5 - Very Poor: Health warnings of emergency conditions, entire population is likely to be affected
